div.p: This element is found in WRITING TEXTUALFEATURES . It allows you to capture information about the societal roles of characters. If the character is noteworthy for being married, single, a fallen woman, a teacher/governess, an immigrant, a suffragist, an invalid, a down-trodden housewife, or a mother, record it here. The tag should contain one- or two-word or slightly longer summations (e.g. charismatic fascist leader, a fragile pensioner formerly a powerful businesswoman). There are no optional or mandatory sub-elements, though you may want to use this element in conjunction with the TCHARACTERIZATION element and possibly with TCHARACTERNAME. An optional attribute, Protagonist, with values of male and female, is used when appropriate to distinguish protagonists or central figures from others.

Your possible vocabulary is not systematized in any way, allowing you full descriptive powers. Your discussion could be enriched by terms such as protagonist, antagonist, villain, and stereotype, but these are suggestions only and not meant to be prescriptive.
